text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade pact signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States. It came into effect on January 1, 1994, creating one of the world’s largest free trade zones. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, fostering increased trade and economic integration12. The agreement was negotiated by the administrations of U.S. President George H.W. Bush, Canadian Prime Minister Brian Mulroney, and Mexican President Carlos Salinas de Gortari. It built upon the earlier Canada-United States Free Trade Agreement of 1988, extending its provisions to Mexico12. NAFTA’s main provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years. This ensured duty-free access for a wide range of goods and services, promoting economic growth and job creation in all three countries2. Despite its benefits, NAFTA faced criticism for its impact on certain industries and workers exposed to trade competition. In 2020, it was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which aimed to address some of these concerns while continuing to promote free trade in North America3.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Robots have become Increaseingly prevalent in the united states, transforming various sectors of society . In manufacturing plants acrosss the wisdoms, industrial robots now handle repetitive assembly tasks that were once performed by human workers. Helathcare facilities emply robots for modication delivery and even some surgical procedures, While delivery robots navigate college campuses and urban areas. Personally , I feel both excited and cautions about their rapid integration. On the positive side , robots enhance productivity and precision in industries ranging from automotive to electronics , potentially boosing economic growth and creating new opportunities in robot design and maintenance . They also perform dangerous tasks like hazardous material handling and disaster response, Keeping humans safe . Howevertheir widespread adoption raises concerns about job displacement , particularly for workers without specialized education . There's also the risk of overdependence on technology and widening inequality if the benefits of the automation primarily flow to companies rather then the workers.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words. Response: Hello ladies and gentlemen.

To begin with, I would like to wishing  a warm welcome to all of you. Today we are here to introduce you to our company.
I would like to start the presentation with a small quiz. Do you know what year Frisco Shipping was founded and by whom? 
To begin with, our company was founded in 2001 by Bill Frisco. Our company has locations in 20 cities around the world and more than 5,000 employees work in our company.
I would like to introduce you to the fact that our last year's profit is 5 million dollars and we are holding 10 percent of the world market. As you can all see, our rate of growth has been rapid. That is why we are hiring a lot of new employees. We expect the new employees to be highly motivated and enthusiastic to continue our rise in the global market. Expansion is a priority. Europe has a lot of potential. Consequently, we are going to expand there soon. 
Finally, I want to tell you an inspiring story about our founder and the birth of the company related on this. Our founder Bill Frisco fell into the ocean and was bitten by a shark. You may know that a passing ship saved his life, which in turn inspired him to start his own shipping company. I hope, you can see that inspiration can be found everywhere.

Before i finish, I will now open the floor for any questions you have.

That is why we are hiring a lot of new employees. We expect the new employees to be highly motivated and enthusiastic to continue our rise in the global market. Expansion is a priority. text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Rewrite the termination section of the contract to take into account possible discrimination either against or by the employer or employee. Compare your amendment with the model. This is a non-graded activity. Response: Contract of Employment

This Agreement is entered into on __________ (date) between:

________________________ (Employer) ("Party A")

and _____________________ (Employee) ("Party B")

Terms of Employment
The employment of Party B shall commence the date hereof and continue for an indefinite term until terminated in accordance with the provisions of this agreement.

Job Title and Description
Party B shall be employed in the capacity of _________________ (job title), the current duties and responsibilities of which are set out in Schedule "A" annexed hereto and forming part of this agreement. These duties and responsibilities may be amended from time to time in the sole discretion of Party A, subject to formal notification of same being provided to Party B.

Working Hours
3.1. You will be required to work a maximum of 40 ordinary working hours per week: 8 ordinary hours per day, 5 days per week.

3.2. Your usual working hours are from 09:00 to 18:00. Party A reserves the right to change your working hours if the need arises.

Probationary period
The parties hereto agree that the initial six (6) month period of this agreement is "probationary" in the following respects:

4.1. Party A shall have an opportunity to assess the performance, attitude, skills and other employment-related attributes and characteristics of Party B. Party B shall have an opportunity to learn about both Party A and the position of employment.

4.2. Either party may terminate the employment relationship at any time during the initial six month period without advance notice or justifiable reason, in which case there will be no continuing obligations of the parties to each other, financial or otherwise.

Salary and Benefits
5.1. In consideration of the services to be provided by him hereunder, Party B, during the term of his employment, shall be paid a fixed annual salary of ________ in equal monthly installments.

5.2. In addition, Party B is entitled to receive benefits in accordance with Party A’s standard benefit package, as amended from time to time.

Confidentiality and Disclosure Clause
You shall not, at any time during the current contract or after the termination of your employment with Party A, divulge to any person any information relating to the trade secrets or trade connections of the company, or any confidential information concerning Party A’s business or affairs without Party A’s consent.

Termination of Employment
7.1. Subsequent to completion of the probationary term of employment referred to in paragraph 4 herein, Party A may terminate the employment of Party B at any time:

(a) for just cause at common law, in which case Party B is not entitled to any advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice;

(b) without just cause, in which case Party A shall provide Party B with advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice equal to 1 month plus 2 weeks per year of completed service with Party A, to a maximum of fifteen (15) months.

7.2. Party B may terminate his employment at any time by providing Party A with at least eight (8) weeks advance notice of his intention to resign.

Jurisdiction
The validity, interpretation, construction and performance of this agreement shall be governed by the Laws of __________.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Rewrite the termination section of the contract to take into account possible discrimination either against or by the employer or employee. Compare your amendment with the model. This is a non-graded activity. Response: 7. Termination of Employment
7.1 Subsequent to completion of the probationary period, this employment may be terminated by either Party with or without cause.
7.2 Termination without cause:
 * By Party A (Employer): Party A may terminate the employment of Party B without cause by providing Party B with advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice as specified in Section 7.2.1.
 * By Party B (Employee): Party B may terminate his employment at any time by providing Party A with at least eight (8) weeks written notice of his intention to resign.
7.2.1 Notice or Compensation in Lieu of Notice: The notice period or compensation in lieu of notice for termination without cause by Party A shall be as follows:
 * One (1) month for employees with less than one (1) year of continuous service.
 * One (1) month plus two (2) weeks for each additional year of continuous service up to a maximum of six (6) months.
7.3 Termination with cause:
 * By Party A (Employer): Party A may terminate the employment of Party B with cause for any of the following reasons:
   * Gross misconduct, including but not limited to:
     * Theft, fraud, or dishonesty.
     * Serious or repeated violations of company policies.
     * Use of illegal drugs or alcohol on company premises.
     * Engaging in conduct that creates a hostile or unsafe work environment.
     * Discrimination or harassment based on any protected characteristic (e.g., race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability).
   * Willful disobedience of lawful and reasonable instructions.
   * Incompetence or failure to meet performance standards after receiving adequate training and support.
   * Unauthorized absence from work.
text_b: 7. Termination of Employment 7.1 Subsequent to completion of the probationary period, this employment may be terminated by either Party with or without cause. 7.2 Termination without cause: * By Party A (Employer): Party A may terminate the employment of Party B without cause by providing Party B with advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice as specified in Section 7.2.1. * By Party B (Employee): Party B may terminate his employment at any time by providing Party A with at least eight (8) weeks written notice of his intention to resign. 7.2.1 Notice or Compensation in Lieu of Notice: The notice period or compensation in lieu of notice for termination without cause by Party A shall be as follows: * One (1) month for employees with less than one (1) year of continuous service. * One (1) month plus two (2) weeks for each additional year of continuous service up to a maximum of six (6) months. 7.3 Termination with cause: * By Party A (Employer): Party A may terminate the employment of Party B with cause for any of the following reasons: * Gross misconduct, including but not limited to: * Theft, fraud, or dishonesty. * Serious or repeated violations of company policies. * Use of illegal drugs or alcohol on company premises. * Engaging in conduct that creates a hostile or unsafe work environment. * Discrimination or harassment based on any protected characteristic (e.g., race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability). * Willful disobedience of lawful and reasonable instructions. * Incompetence or failure to meet performance standards after receiving adequate training and support. * Unauthorized absence from work.

**Date:** March 23, 2025  
**Aircraft:** Cessna 123  


**Summary:**
On March 23, 2025, Cessna 123 experienced landing issues at [Airport Name]. The aircraft encountered turbulence during descent, leading to an unstable approach. The pilot executed a go-around maneuver but faced difficulties due to crosswinds.

**Details:**
- **Turbulence:** Moderate turbulence was reported at 3,000 feet, causing the aircraft to deviate from its glide path.
- **Crosswinds:** Strong crosswinds at 15 knots affected the aircraft's stability during the final approach.
- **Go-Around:** The pilot initiated a go-around but struggled to maintain altitude due to wind shear.

**Outcome:**
The aircraft landed safely on the second attempt with no injuries reported. Minor damage to the landing gear was noted.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. Response: nan
text_b: Buying a house or a flat in my country is a very time-consuming process, and it costs lots of money, too, unless you settle for living in rural areas, or don't mind living in an extremely small appartment. House pricing has been steadily increasing during the last 20 years or so, and there is no end in sight . In order to buy a houseyou contact a real estate agency of your choice. When making a contract, you need to pay a large part of the total price up front. In most cases, the buyer needs a loan, which is provided by ordinary banks. The real estate agent helps in contacting the bank, in particular, the appartment to be bought will serve as an asset which then guarantees that the buyer will be able to pay back the loan (actuallythe bank acquires the real estate asset if you fail to make your loan payments). When making the loan contract, you have to provide documents that prove your identity, your residence status, your employment status, your recent income, as well as your recent savings account history. If there are no problems and the loan contract is approved, the real estate purchase contract will be made. The seller receives the remaining payment immediately, but you then usually pay off the loan in monthly rates, and in many cases it will take more than 10 years - up to 30 years - to pay it off. The loan itself may use fixed or flexible interest rates, where fixed rates were as low as 1.0% a couple of years ago, but have risen to more than 2.5% lately.

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b:
<input>An airplane is a complex machine with several key components, each serving a specific function to ensure safe and efficient flight. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane, housing the cockpit, passenger seats, and cargo. It provides structural integrity and aerodynamic shape, allowing the aircraft to slice through the air smoothly.

The wings are crucial for generating lift, enabling the airplane to rise off the ground. They are designed with airfoils that create a pressure difference between the upper and lower surfaces, facilitating upward movement. Wings may also include control surfaces like ailerons and flaps to aid in maneuverability and stability during flight.

The tail, also known as the empennage, consists of the horizontal stabilizer and vertical stabilizer. The horizontal stabilizer helps maintain balance and control pitch, while the vertical stabilizer provides directional stability and houses the rudder, which is used for steering the airplane left or right.

Finally, the engines are the powerhouse of the airplane, providing thrust to propel it forward. Modern airplanes typically use jet engines, which are efficient and powerful, allowing for high-speed travel over long distances. Together, these parts work in harmony to ensure an airplane can fly safely and effectively.</input>

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Exploring the Charm of Kyoto, Then the Energy of New York City

Kyoto, Japan, is my favorite city because of its serene beauty and deep cultural roots. Walking through Kyoto feels like stepping into a living museum. Ancient temples, peaceful gardens, and traditional tea houses create a calm, reflective atmosphere. The pace of life is slower, encouraging mindfulness and appreciation of small details—like the sound of bamboo rustling or the sight of cherry blossoms falling.

Then there’s New York City, a place that pulses with energy and ambition. Skyscrapers tower over bustling streets, and every corner offers something new—street performers, food trucks, or spontaneous conversations. Unlike Kyoto’s quiet charm, New York thrives on movement and diversity. It’s a city where people chase dreams and where cultures collide in vibrant harmony.

While Kyoto offers peace and tradition, New York offers excitement and innovation. Both cities are unforgettable, but in very different ways. One soothes the soul; the other sparks the imagination.
text_b:
<input>Exploring the Charm of Kyoto, Then the Energy of New York City

Kyoto, Japan, is my favorite city because of its serene beauty and deep cultural roots. Walking through Kyoto feels like stepping into a living museum. Ancient temples, peaceful gardens, and traditional tea houses create a calm, reflective atmosphere. The pace of life is slower, encouraging mindfulness and appreciation of small details—like the sound of bamboo rustling or the sight of cherry blossoms falling.

Then there’s New York City, a place that pulses with energy and ambition. Skyscrapers tower over bustling streets, and every corner offers something new—street performers, food trucks, or spontaneous conversations. Unlike Kyoto’s quiet charm, New York thrives on movement and diversity. It’s a city where people chase dreams and where cultures collide in vibrant harmony.

While Kyoto offers peace and tradition, New York offers excitement and innovation. Both cities are unforgettable, but in very different ways. One soothes the soul; the other sparks the imagination.</input>

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: As there were a few problems with Cessna 123's landing, you have been asked to write a report by your superiors. Write the report below. Write 100 - 150 words. Response: Landing Report – Cessna 123

On June 25th at approximately 14:40, Cessna 123 experienced several issues during its landing at Runway 22. The pilot reported sudden crosswinds shortly before touchdown, which caused a brief deviation from the centerline. Additionally, the aircraft experienced minor instability due to a delayed flap deployment. Despite these challenges, the pilot managed to regain control and complete the landing safely. Ground inspection found no damage to the aircraft, and no injuries were reported.

It is recommended that a review of crosswind landing procedures be conducted with the pilot, and that the flap mechanism be inspected for possible delay or malfunction. Overall, the incident was managed professionally, but preventative measures should be taken to avoid future complications.
text_b: Landing Report – Cessna 123 On June 25th at approximately 14:40, Cessna 123 experienced several issues during its landing at Runway 22. The pilot reported sudden crosswinds shortly before touchdown, which caused a brief deviation from the centerline. Additionally, the aircraft experienced minor instability due to a delayed flap deployment. Despite these challenges, the pilot managed to regain control and complete the landing safely. Ground inspection found no damage to the aircraft, and no injuries were reported. It is recommended that a review of crosswind landing procedures be conducted with the pilot, and that the flap mechanism be inspected for possible delay or malfunction. Overall, the incident was managed professionally, but preventative measures should be taken to avoid future complications.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. Response: **Flight 293 Incident Summary Report**

On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293, a scheduled domestic passenger service, was forced to execute an emergency landing at San Francisco International Airport (SFO) due to a critical mechanical failure involving the aircraft’s nose landing gear. The Airbus, carrying 141 passengers and six crew members, initially departed Oakland, California at 15:31, bound for Phoenix, Arizona. However, shortly after takeoff, the flight crew received a fault warning regarding the nose landing gear shock absorber and nose wheel steering system.

While the aircraft’s climb appeared normal at first, the cockpit's control panel displayed concerning error messages. In response, the captain diverted the flight to San Jose, California, where air traffic controllers, airline ground personnel, and a nearby news helicopter visually confirmed that the nose wheels were locked 90 degrees to the left — a potentially hazardous configuration for landing.

Recognizing the severity of the situation, the captain made the strategic decision to divert again, this time to SFO, which offered superior runway length, optimal surface conditions, and enhanced emergency services. To minimize risk upon landing, the crew flew in holding patterns for several hours to reduce fuel weight.

In preparation for a potentially dangerous touchdown, the captain informed the cabin crew of the gear malfunction and advised that passengers would evacuate through the rear exits in case of a nose gear collapse. The crew maintained clear communication with the passengers, calmly preparing them for emergency procedures without causing panic.

During final approach, the captain skillfully controlled the descent, touching down at approximately 120 knots. He delayed nose gear contact for as long as possible, applying normal braking at 90 knots. The engines were shut down at 60 knots to prevent complications. The flight crew deliberately avoided using reverse thrust or automatic braking systems to maintain greater manual control. Upon ground contact, the nose tires rapidly deteriorated, shredding and exposing the axle, though the aircraft’s trajectory remained stable throughout.

Though the forward cabin crew reported the smell of burning rubber during deceleration, the control tower quickly confirmed that there was no fire on board. Following this reassurance, the aircraft came to a safe stop, and passengers disembarked calmly via an air stair, without injuries or further incident.

Despite the severe nose gear malfunction, the flight crew’s professionalism, precision, and calm under pressure ensured the safety of all on board. The incident stands as a textbook example of decisive leadership, effective communication, and expert airmanship in the face of a mechanical emergency.
text_b: **Flight 293 Incident Summary Report** On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293, a scheduled domestic passenger service, was forced to execute an emergency landing at San Francisco International Airport (SFO) due to a critical mechanical failure involving the aircraft’s nose landing gear. The Airbus, carrying 141 passengers and six crew members, initially departed Oakland, California at 15:31, bound for Phoenix, Arizona. However, shortly after takeoff, the flight crew received a fault warning regarding the nose landing gear shock absorber and nose wheel steering system. While the aircraft’s climb appeared normal at first, the cockpit's control panel displayed concerning error messages. In response, the captain diverted the flight to San Jose, California, where air traffic controllers, airline ground personnel, and a nearby news helicopter visually confirmed that the nose wheels were locked 90 degrees to the left — a potentially hazardous configuration for landing. Recognizing the severity of the situation, the captain made the strategic decision to divert again, this time to SFO, which offered superior runway length, optimal surface conditions, and enhanced emergency services. To minimize risk upon landing, the crew flew in holding patterns for several hours to reduce fuel weight. In preparation for a potentially dangerous touchdown, the captain informed the cabin crew of the gear malfunction and advised that passengers would evacuate through the rear exits in case of a nose gear collapse. The crew maintained clear communication with the passengers, calmly preparing them for emergency procedures without causing panic. During final approach, the captain skillfully controlled the descent, touching down at approximately 120 knots. He delayed nose gear contact for as long as possible, applying normal braking at 90 knots. The engines were shut down at 60 knots to prevent complications. The flight crew deliberately avoided using reverse thrust or automatic braking systems to maintain greater manual control. Upon ground contact, the nose tires rapidly deteriorated, shredding and exposing the axle, though the aircraft’s trajectory remained stable throughout. Though the forward cabin crew reported the smell of burning rubber during deceleration, the control tower quickly confirmed that there was no fire on board. Following this reassurance, the aircraft came to a safe stop, and passengers disembarked calmly via an air stair, without injuries or further incident. Despite the severe nose gear malfunction, the flight crew’s professionalism, precision, and calm under pressure ensured the safety of all on board. The incident stands as a textbook example of decisive leadership, effective communication, and expert airmanship in the face of a mechanical emergency.

text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Harry, Here are some practical tips to effectively motivate your team, along with strategies to avoid: **Motivation Tips:** 1. **Recognize and reward efforts:** Celebrating accomplishments, big or small, can boost morale and engagement. 2. **Encourage growth:** Support professional development by providing opportunities for training and skill-building. 3. **Foster open communication:** Regularly check in with your team to understand their concerns and ideas. 4. **Lead by example:** Demonstrate the values and work ethic you want your team to embody. 5. **Promote balance:** Respect your team’s time and encourage a healthy work-life balance. **What to Avoid:** 1. **Micromanaging:** This can stifle creativity and lower morale. 2. **Ignoring contributions:** Failing to acknowledge hard work can lead to disengagement. 3. **Unclear expectations:** Ambiguity can cause frustration and inefficiency. 4. **Favoritism:** Treat all team members fairly to build trust. 5. **Neglecting feedback:** Not acting on team input can create a disconnect. Focus on building trust and fostering a collaborative environment. Best of luck with your team! Best regards, Polakam Riya

text_a: Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Two Argentine Cities: Buenos Aires and Córdoba Buenos Aires is my favorite city. This incredible city is a vibrant hub of culture, culinary delightand architectural beauty. The city's culinary scene is a feast for the senseswith restaurants serving mouthwatering asado (meat), empanadasand exquisite pasta. Traditional "Bodegones" restaurants hold a special place in my heartserving generous portions of classic Argentine cuisine. Architecturally, Buenos Aires is a mix of the old and the newwith landmarks like the historic Palacio Barolo standing alongside modern structures like the MAMBA. Growing up in Buenos Aires, surrounded by family and friends, has made it a place close to my heart. In contrast, Córdoba, where I currently resideoffers a different charm. Known as the "city of students" or "Docta", it attracts young people from across Argentina, creating a lively atmosphere filled with cultural activities and nightlife. The Sierras de Córdoba provide a natural escape, offering breathtaking landscapes just an hour from the city. While Córdoba has its appeal, especially with its youthful energy and proximity to nature, Buenos Aires remains my favorite, holding a special place with its rich culture, history, and people. In conclusion, Buenos Aires captivates with its cultural richness and personal significance, while Córdoba enchants with its dynamic student life and natural beauty. Each city offers unique experiences, but Buenos Aires remains my favorite forever.

So, picture this: I'm in the produce aisle, minding my own business, when suddenly a squirrel comes darting across the floor. Yes, a squirrel! It was zig-zagging between the apples and bananas like it was on a mission.

As I stood there, bewildered, one of the store employees rushed over with a broom, trying to gently guide the little critter outside. But the squirrel was having none of it! Eventually, the squirrel found its way out the automatic doors, leaving behind a trail of amused and confused shoppers. I couldn't help but chuckle all the way home. Who knew grocery shopping could be so entertaining?

Hope you're having a less chaotic day!

Catch up soon, [Sreeta]

text_a:
Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: For me the best techniques for a creative writing are questioning and cubing.
Questioning technique is a five-step process which allows you to: recognize the richness and diversity of your subject (exploration); gather as much information as possible about this aspect (discovery); make some sense out of the body of information you’ve assembled (classification); determine what you want to say to the reader, and the order in which you want to say it (selecting and ordering).

Cubing technique is when before people write something important they often start with pre-writing to help them organize ideas, outline and clarify their thoughts and sort through what they really want to write.
A cube can help a person to think about their topic. It can be observed and described from six different angles and a few minutes can be spent writing about each of these. Any six prompts can be used on the cube. As an example, the six sides of a cube can be: describe, compare, associate, analyze, apply and argue.
text_b: For methe best techniques for a creative writing are questioning and cubing. Questioning technique is a five-step process which allows you to: recognize the richness and diversity of your subject (exploration); gather as much information as possible about this aspect (discovery); make some sense out of the body of information you’ve assembled (classification); determine what you want to say to the reader, and the order in which you want to say it (selecting and ordering). Cubing technique is when before people write something important they often start with pre-writing to help them organize ideas, outline and clarify their thoughtsand sort through what they really want to write. A cube can help a person to think about their topic. It can be observed and described from six different angles and a few minutes can be spent writing about each of these. Any six prompts can be used on the cube. As an example, the six sides of a cube can be: describe, compare, associate, analyze, applyand argue.

Prompt Level: 11.0 Prompt: Read the blog about a law in Japan, then write about a law in your country. Type in the input box. Write 60-90 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: A Law in India
India has a fascinating law called the Indian Treasure Trove Act, 1878. If someone finds hidden treasure worth more than 10 rupees, they must report it to the authorities. The government then decides whether the finder can keep it or if it belongs to the state. This law prevents people from secretly keeping valuable discoveries and ensures historical artifacts are preserved. While it may seem unusual, it helps protect India's rich heritage and prevents disputes over ownership. Would you follow this law if you found treasure?

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: <input>The concept of celebrity often highlights the superficial aspects of fame, overshadowing genuine talent and hard work. Many celebrities are celebrated more for their social media presence and personal lives than for their actual contributions to their fields. This can create unrealistic standards and values, especially for young people who look up to them. The constant media attention and the pressure to maintain a certain image can lead to a lack of authenticity, with celebrities often presenting a curated version of their lives. Additionally, the immense wealth and privilege that come with celebrity status can create a disconnect from the everyday struggles of ordinary people. This disparity can foster a sense of entitlement and detachment, making it difficult for celebrities to relate to their fans. While there are certainly celebrities who use their platform for positive change, the overall culture of celebrity can sometimes promote vanity and materialism over substance and integrity.</input>

Set on a remote Irish island in the 1920s, the story follows two lifelong friends, Pádraic and Colm, who suddenly fall out when Colm decides he no longer wants to speak to Pádraic. What unfolds is a dark, tragic unraveling of their friendship, filled with absurd moments and deep sadness. Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Last year during the winter holyday a friend of mine Federico travelled with a group of friend to Marrakesh, Morocco. It was a short stay, just a couple of days, a different gateaway than the classic mountain trip.

They decided to stay in a Riad, a typical moroccan house inside the Medina old city centre. The location was perfetct, just  a cuple of streets away from the the famous Jemaa el-Fnaa square.

The first day they explored the maze-like alleys of the Medina, and wandered the souks in search of little treasure to bring home. Spices, silk, ceramics and all kind of trinkets filled the stands to the brim.
Still the best part of the holiday remained the one day trip to the desert.

They departed early in the morning, the city was calm and silent still asleep in the early hours, such a contrast to the buzzing  and bustling evenings!
Halfaway the car ride they had a stop to a local Argan shop; it was a only female traditional company. They watched them make all argan byproducts, oil but also marmalade, butter an honey. I'd never imagined there were so much different things made of it!

After enjoyung a nice mint tea an some typical pastry they boarded the bus to reach their true destination. Near a rural village the cap was set; after setting their stuff they prepared for the camel ride in the desert. Imangine: a whole grop of 10 adults wobbling an shuffling prcauriosly on top of their mighty steeds, it must have been hilarious!
The dinner was served at the sunset all typical food, chicken and lamb tajines, cous cous, soups and bread and at the end the mandatory mint tea obviously! They watched a beatiful show of mroccan songs and dancing and even a fire show just before retiring for the night.

Last but not least they wake up around 1 a.m. to watch the night sky; without the light pollution and in the endless plains of the desert surrounding them the number of stars was countless!

As their trip came to an end, they promised to return to Morocco to visit all the other missing city from Casablanca to Rabat. For the time being they wait for their next adventure, Istanbul here they come!

It was a short stay, just a couple of days, a different gateaway than the classic mountain trip. They decided to stay in a Riad, a typical moroccan house inside the Medina old city centre. The location was perfetct, just a cuple of streets away from the the famous Jemaa el-Fnaa square. The first day they explored the maze-like alleys of the Medina, and wandered the souks in search of little treasure to bring home. Spices, silk, ceramicsand all kind of trinkets filled the stands to the brim. Stillthe best part of the holiday remained the oneday trip to the desert. They departed early in the morning, the city was calm and silentstill asleep in the early hours, such a contrast to the buzzing and bustling evenings! Halfaway the car ridethey had a stop to a local Argan shop; it was a only female traditional company. They watched them make all argan byproducts, oil but also marmalade, butteran honey. I'd never imagined there were so much different things made of it! After enjoyung a nice mint tea an some typical pastrythey boarded the bus to reach their true destination. Near a rural villagethe cap was set; after setting their stuffthey prepared for the camel ride in the desert. Imangine: a whole grop of 10 adults wobbling an shuffling prcauriosly on top of their mighty steeds, it must have been hilarious! The dinner was served at the sunset all typical food, chicken and lamb tajines, cous cous, soups and breadand at the end the mandatory mint tea obviously! They watched a beatiful show of mroccan songs and dancing and even a fire show just before retiring for the night. Last but not leastthey wake up around 1 a.m. to watch the night sky; without the light pollution and in the endless plains of the desert surrounding themthe number of stars was countless! As their trip came to an end, they promised to return to Morocco to visit all the other missing city from Casablanca to Rabat. For the time beingthey wait for their next adventure, Istanbul here they come!

It was a Sunday afternoon, the kind where the sun shines and human lazes around. Anya was looking at her dog,Leowho was jollying around in the backyard of her home. Suddenly, a gentle clinking sound started, and before they knew it, delicate porcelain teacups of all shapes and sizes began to fall from the clear blue sky. Leo, initially startled, started batting at the descending crockery with his paws, while Anya could only stare updards in bewildered amusement. People around her also stopped doing everything and looked up in aweand a few tried to catch the teacups, resulting in a few comical clatters. Anya managed to snag a beautiful floral one, miraculously intact. The teacup rain lasted for around 10 minutes, ceasing as abruptly as it began. The park was left with porcelain glittering in the sunlight. Noone could explain what just happened as there were no clouds or aeroplanes overhead from where these crockery could have possibly downpoured from. Anya still keeps that floral teacup on her mantlepiece as a constant remainder of the day when the skies decided to have a tea party.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: A Strange Day at the Train Station

Last month, something very interesting happened to my friend Riya. She was going to visit her aunt in another city and had to catch an early morning train. When she reached the station, she saw a small puppy sitting alone near the ticket counter. It looked scared and hungry.

Riya loves animals, so she bought some biscuits and gave them to the puppy. Then, something surprising happened. The puppy started following her everywhere — even onto the train! The train guard saw this and smiled. He said, “Looks like you have a new travel partner!”

Riya didn’t know what to do, but the other passengers were kind. They helped her take care of the puppy during the journey. When she reached her aunt’s house, she decided to keep the puppy and named him “Lucky.”

Now, Lucky is a happy part of her family. That one small moment at the station changed both their lives.
text_b: A Strange Day at the Train Station Last month, something very interesting happened to my friend Riya. She was going to visit her aunt in another city and had to catch an early morning train. Then, something surprising happened. The puppy started following her everywhere — even onto the train! The train guard saw this and smiled. He said, “Looks like you have a new travel partner!” Riya didn’t know what to do, but the other passengers were kind. They helped her take care of the puppy during the journey. When she reached her aunt’s house, she decided to keep the puppy and named him “Lucky.” Now, Lucky is a happy part of her family. That one small moment at the station changed both their lives.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Dear Harry,

I wanted to share a few ideas that could help you motivate your employees and boost their productivity.

Firstly, incentivizing employees can be a great way to encourage performance. When they see that their efforts contribute to the company's success and can lead to personal rewards, they are more likely to stay engaged. Additionally, taking an active interest in your employees' career paths by offering training and mentorship will show that you care about their growth and development.

A healthy work-life balance is also essential. Recognizing that employees have personal lives outside of work will help reduce burnout and increase overall satisfaction. Listening to your employees is another vital point; people feel valued when they are heard, even if they are voicing complaints. Moreover, treating your subordinates with respect and empathy fosters a positive environment where everyone feels supported.

On the flip side, here are some things to avoid that could demotivate your staff: disrespecting subordinates, taking credit for their work, losing your temper, allowing unfair blame, and failing to acknowledge good work.

I hope these suggestions are helpful! Best of luck managing your team.

Sincerely, [Diksha]

I hope these suggestions are helpful! Best of luck managing your team. Sincerely, [Diksha]

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: The idea of celebrity culture has both positive and negative aspects, but its drawbacks often outweigh its benefits. Many celebrities achieve fame not because of their talent or hard work but due to social media hype, controversies, or mere luck. This creates unrealistic role models who influence society in questionable ways. One major issue is the obsession with celebrities’ personal lives. The media constantly invades their privacy, and fans blindly follow every detail, often ignoring more important social issues. This idolization also promotes unhealthy beauty standards, as many celebrities undergo cosmetic procedures or excessive editing to maintain an unrealistic image. As a result, fans feel pressured to conform to these unattainable ideals. Furthermore, some celebrities misuse their influence by spreading misinformation, engaging in scandals, or endorsing harmful products solely for profit. Despite their wealth and power, many fail to use their platform responsibly. Instead of focusing on meaningful contributions, they often prioritize personal gain over positive societal impact. Ultimately, while some celebrities do use their fame for good, the culture surrounding celebrity worship is largely problematic and distracts society from more significant matters.

Response: Leadership is an essential quality that encompasses various attributes necessary for guiding and inspiring others towards achieving common goals. Effective leaders possess a clear vision and the ability to communicate it compellingly, fostering trust and commitment within their team. Empathy is a crucial trait, enabling leaders to understand and address the needs and emotions of their team members, thereby creating a supportive and collaborative work environment. Integrity and ethical behavior are foundational to leadership, ensuring that decisions are made with fairness and transparency, which in turn builds credibility and respect. Adaptability is another key characteristic, as leaders must navigate and overcome challenges, adjusting strategies as circumstances change. Additionally, the ability to delegate tasks and empower team members is vital for fostering growth and development, both individually and collectively. By recognizing and nurturing the strengths of their team, leaders can cultivate a culture of continuous improvement and innovation, driving success and achieving organizational objectives.

Prompt Level: 12.0 Prompt: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: I work for a global company. I've been lucky enough to travel around the world and do business with many different people in many different countries. What I've learned is that understanding cross-cultural differences is critical for successful communication.

For example, people from my culture are apt to maintain eye contact in a conversation. In some countries I've visited, however, maintaining eye contact can be considered rather rude or even aggressive. I also have a way of gesturing a lot – you know, like moving my hands and pointing. In one country, I learned that pointing with a finger is somewhat impolite. Oh, yeah – and I have a tendency to talk a lot and be quite direct. I also tend to be a little uncomfortable with silence. There are a lot of countries where just the opposite is true.

I guess my point is that it's important to be sensitive to the culture you're working in. You don't have to be perfect, but a little understanding goes a long way!

In some countries I've visited, however, maintaining eye contact can be considered rather rude or even aggressive. I also have a way of gesturing a lot – you know, like moving my hands and pointing. In one country, I learned that pointing with a finger is somewhat impolite. Oh, yeah – and I have a tendency to talk a lot and be quite direct. I also tend to be a little uncomfortable with silence. There are a lot of countries where just the opposite is true. I guess my point is that it's important to be sensitive to the culture you're working in. You don't have to be perfect, but a little understanding goes a long way!

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. Response: nan
text_b: On June 13, 2010, at 1818 Pacific Daylight Time, InterStar Airways Flight 293, landed at San Francisco International Airport (SFO), San Francisco, California, with the nose wheels cocked at 90 degrees. InterStar Airways was operating the airplane as a scheduled domestic passenger flight. The captain, first officer, four flight attendants, and 141 passengers were not injured. The flight departed Oakland, California, at 1531 as a non-stop to Sky Harbor International Airport, Phoenix, Arizona. The captain noted no problems during the initial departure, and observed a positive rate of climb. The flight crew noted an error message displayed on the control board. There was a fault message for a nose landing gear shock absorber. The data indicated that the gear handle was positioned to the down position, and there was an error message of a fault for the nose wheel steering. The flight diverted to San Jose, California. The captain was asked to perform a flyby of the tower for verification on the gear status. The tower, InterStar ground personnel, and a local news helicopter advised him that the nose gear was cocked 90 degrees to the left. When he found out this information, the captain decided to divert to SFO because it had optimum field conditions, a longer runway, and a better emergency support services. The crew flew for several hours to burn fuel so that they could land at a lighter weight. The captain advised the cabin crew that in the event that the nose gear collapsed, evacuation from the front doors was not available so everyone would deplane from the rear exits. The flight crew continually updated the cabin crew and passengers about the situation, and advised the cabin crew to prepare for emergency procedures. The captain flew the airplane for the landing. He touched down at 120 knots, and applied normal braking at 90 knots. He held the nose gear off of the ground as long as possible. At 60 knots, the flight crew shut down the engines. They did not use reverse thrust or auto-braking. During the landing, the forward cabin crew could smell burnt rubber. The air traffic control tower confirmed that there was no fire, and the captain announced this to the cabin crew. After this notification, the passengers deplaned normally using an air stair. Upon touchdown, the tires rapidly deflated and tore apart, and both wheels were worn into the axle. During landing, the airplane's trajectory was not affected by the abnormal configuration or subsequent tire destruction, and the airplane stayed on the runway centerline.

Also, do you remember Tia, the girl I met in the coffee shop a few months ago? Well, things aren't going well between us, and I think we might end the relationship. That's got me feeling really down because I thought it was going well for a while. Sorry for bothering you with this – I've got no one else to talk about this, and I just needed to vent. You always seem to be so calm and in control; maybe you have some advice for me on how I can deal with these problems? Thanks, Leon

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: In Indian folklore, the Yeti, also known as the Abominable Snowman, stands out as a legendary creature steeped in mystery and intrigue. This elusive, ape-like being is said to inhabit the remote, snow-clad regions of the Himalayas, including areas like Ladakh, Kumaun, Himachal Pradesh, and Arunachal Pradesh. The Yeti is often described as a large, bipedal creature covered in shaggy white fur, leaving behind enormous footprints in the snow that have sparked curiosity and speculation for generations. Despite the harsh and unforgiving terrain, stories and claims of Yeti sightings persist, with locals and trekkers recounting encounters that range from fleeting glimpses to eerie sounds echoing through the mountain valleys. In Northeast India, particularly in the dense, subtropical forests of Meghalaya's Garo Hills, tales of the Mande Burung, a creature similar to the Yeti, circulate among the indigenous communities. The Mande Burung is believed to be a more localized version of the Yeti, sharing many characteristics with its Himalayan counterpart. These creatures are often considered guardians of the forests, embodying the wild and untamed spirit of nature that remains a crucial part of Indian folklore and cultural heritage. Indian folklore is rich with tales of mythical creatures that continue to captivate the imagination and are occasionally claimed to be sighted even today. Some of the most popular legendary beings include Shesha Naga, also known as Vasuki, which are serpent-like beings revered as water spirits and associated with fertility, wealth, and kingship. They are often linked with Hindu deities, especially Vishnu. Another revered creature is Garuda, a divine bird-like being that serves as the mount of Lord Vishnu and symbolizes power and divine protection. Additionally, Yakshas are nature spirits often depicted as guardians of treasures and natural elements, embodying the connection between humans and the natural world. These creatures not only represent various aspects of nature and spirituality but also play significant roles in the cultural narratives and religious practices of India.

text_a: Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Last weekend, my friend Sarah had an experience that she’ll never forget. It all started with a simple plan to go hiking in the nearby mountains. Sarah, an avid nature lover, was excited to explore a new trail she had read about online. Little did she know, this hike would turn into an unexpected adventure. As she reached the halfway point of the trail, Sarah noticed dark clouds gathering in the sky. Within minutes, a sudden downpour began, turning the trail into a slippery mess. Determined to continue, she pressed on, carefully navigating the muddy path. Just as she was about to turn back, she stumbled upon a small, hidden waterfall cascading down the rocks. The sight was breathtaking, and Sarah felt a sense of accomplishment for pushing through the challenging conditions. To top it off, she met a group of fellow hikers who were also caught in the rain. They shared stories, snacks, and laughter, making the experience even more memorable. By the time Sarah returned home, she was soaked but exhilarated, with a new story to tell and a reminder of the beauty that can be found in unexpected moments. I hope you enjoyed this little story! Do you have any other topics in mind?

text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: The NAFTA agreement is a regional trade agreement that was signed among the three Countries of North America: Canada, the United States, and Mexico. The agreement consists in improving trade policies among the three member states, and reducing (and in some cases eliminating) custom duties on agricultural goods. Although the agreement came into force in January 1994, it took many years to got it. In fact, the agreement has positive impacts on trade policies, especially for the less advantaged country, Mexico, which can export fruits and vegetables to the US market more easily and without paying taxes. In other words, the agreement facilitates different trade exchanges, but on the other hand can be seen like a brake from richer countries, like the US, that had political end economic power to impose custom duties. Overall, benefits are for all the threes member states, and the agreement has also became a guarantee of regional stability.

Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Drafted Speech (Metaphor: A Ship Navigating the Sea)

Ladies and gentlemen,

Imagine our company as a ship sailing through unpredictable waters. Each department is a vital crew — the engineers in the engine room, the strategists at the helm, the communicators in the crow’s nest. Together, we steer this vessel toward new horizons.

Of course, storms arise. Some challenges are rough waves that rock us slightly — delays, tight deadlines, or shifting markets. Others are hidden reefs — unexpected costs or internal miscommunication. But with every obstacle, we learn to navigate better.

Our crews — from IT squads to marketing units — have proven their resilience. You've tightened the sails, adjusted the course, and kept us afloat even in turbulent times.

As captain of this journey, I don’t take credit alone. It’s your commitment, your insight, your teamwork that has made the difference.

Let’s continue to read the map together, anticipate the storms, and celebrate each safe harbor we reach.

The ocean ahead is vast, but our compass is strong. And with this crew, I have no doubt — we will reach remarkable destinations.

Thank you.
text_b: Drafted Speech (Metaphor: A Ship Navigating the Sea) Ladies and gentlemen, Imagine our company as a ship sailing through unpredictable waters. Each department is a vital crew — the engineers in the engine room, the strategists at the helm, the communicators in the crow’s nest. Together, we steer this vessel toward new horizons. Of course, storms arise. Some challenges are rough waves that rock us slightly — delays, tight deadlines, or shifting markets. Others are hidden reefs — unexpected costs or internal miscommunication. But with every obstacle, we learn to navigate better. Our crews — from IT squads to marketing units — have proven their resilience. You've tightened the sails, adjusted the course, and kept us afloat even in turbulent times. As captain of this journey, I don’t take credit alone. It’s your commitment, your insight, your teamwork that has made the difference. Let’s continue to read the map together, anticipate the storms, and celebrate each safe harbor we reach. The ocean ahead is vast, but our compass is strong. And with this crew, I have no doubt — we will reach remarkable destinations. Thank you.

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Summarize the terms of a contract to your boss, Mr. Kent. Write 75–150 words. Response: nan
text_b: Dear Mr. Kent, Today, I had a meeting to sign a contract with Design Inc. The terms of the contract are as follows : Design Inc. was represented by Clark Philipps, general manager, and our company “Green Solutions” was represented by me, Finance Manager. Design Inc. is committed to providing 250 Xu Console desk by September 30, 2017. The payment terms are as follows : half the payment upon receipt of the goods and full payment must be made within 30 days of delivery. We have the right to examine the goods and have 21 days to notify the seller of any claim for damages. If we don't make any claims within this time framethis will be considered acceptance of the goods. All risk of loss to the described goods is borne by Seller until we received them. I hope these conditions are acceptable to you. Have a nice day. Finance Manager

Emphasized the emotional distress and inconvenience caused to the plaintiff. Requested compensation for damages and legal costs. Defendant’s Lawyer: Claimed the defendant believed they had implied consent to enter the property. Argued there was no damage or harm caused by the entry. The judge stated that the defendant did not have permission to enter the property, regardless of intent. The defendant was ordered to pay compensation for damages and court costs. Observations for Future Reference: Intent is not always required for trespassing — unauthorized entry alone is enough. Emotional distress and inconvenience can influence the court’s decision. text_a:
Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Criticism of celebrities often stems from various sources, including fans, media outlets, and the public, and can focus on their work, personal lives, or public image. While some criticism can be constructive, leading to positive change or improved performance, much of it is negative and can be harmful to the celebrity's mental and emotional well-being. 
Here's a more detailed breakdown of different aspects of celebrity criticism:
Sources of Criticism:
Fans:
Fans, often passionate about a specific celebrity, can react negatively to any perceived criticism or negative comments about their idol, even if it's constructive feedback. 
Media Outlets:
Media outlets, including newspapers, magazines, and online platforms, often provide reviews and analyses of celebrity work, which can be positive or negative. 
The General Public:
The general public can also express their opinions on celebrities, often through social media, blogs, and online forums, leading to both positive and negative commentary. 
Common Themes of Criticism:
Work Quality:
Celebrities are frequently criticized for the quality of their work, including acting, singing, writing, or other artistic endeavors. 
Personal Lives:
Celebrity personal lives are often scrutinized, with criticism directed at their relationships, social activities, or personal choices. 
Public Image:
Celebrities' public image can be the target of criticism, with concerns about their behavior, endorsements, or social media presence. 
Impact of Criticism:
Emotional Distress:
Criticism can be emotionally damaging for celebrities, leading to feelings of stress, anxiety, and depression.
Damage to Reputation:
Negative criticism can harm a celebrity's reputation and impact their career prospects.
Influence on Behavior:
Extensive criticism can sometimes lead celebrities to change their behavior or appearance in an attempt to appease their critics. 
Examples of Criticism:
Reviews of Movies or Music:
Critics may review a celebrity's film or album, offering positive or negative feedback on their performance or the quality of the work. 
Criticism of Social Media Posts:
Celebrities' social media posts can be scrutinized for various reasons, leading to both praise and criticism. 
Personal Life Scrutiny:
Celebrities' personal lives are often subject to media scrutiny, with criticism directed at relationships, family, or other personal aspects.

While some criticism can be constructive, leading to positive change or improved performance, much of it is negative and can be harmful to the celebrity's mental and emotional well-being. text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Think of something weird, exciting or funny that happened to you recently, and describe it in an email to a friend. Make it interesting and descriptive, and remember to check for pronoun reference. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: I hope you're doing well! I just had to share this bizarre and hilarious experience I had last weekend. So, I decided to take a spontaneous trip to the countryside to get away from the city hustle. I found this quaint little bed and breakfast that looked straight out of a fairy tale. On my first morning there, I went for a walk in the nearby woods. As I was admiring the scenery, I stumbled upon a group of people dressed in medieval costumes, having what seemed like a full-blown Renaissance fair. They were jousting, dancing, and even had a makeshift market with handmade crafts. It was like stepping into a time machine! The funniest part? They thought I was part of the event! Before I knew it, I was handed a wooden sword and roped into a mock sword fight. I have to admit, I got really into it and even won a "knightly" title for my efforts. The whole experience was surreal and absolutely hilarious. I can't wait to tell you more about it in person. Let's catch up soon!

text_a:
Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Move over, werewolves and vampires. There’s a big, richly imaginative and extremely spooky world of desi ghosts, monsters and mythical creatures just waiting to devour…er to be discovered and given their rightful place in popular culture. Some of them can be found crawling through the pages of ancient texts, some adorn temple walls, while the stories of others are told through whispers and hushed songs, their forms changing and twisting with each narration. There are thousands of mythical creatures of Indian origin, but in the interest of space, attention span and potential Halloween costumes, we’ve prepared a list of seven fantastic creatures and where to find them (but hopefully you won’t go looking for them).

Tekhumiavi
The tale of the tekhumiavi or the were-tiger is popular among the Angami tribe of Nagaland. Unlike werewolves, were-tigers don’t transform from human to animal completely. Instead, only the soul of the human shifts to a tiger’s body, while the human body functions normally, albeit soulless for the time being. While in this form, the human behaves just like a tiger, and the human body experiences everything the tiger body does – somewhat like what happens in the Matrix. 

Now, how does one tell a tekhumiavi from a regular tiger? Simple – the were-tiger has five claws instead of four, so you can tell from the pugmarks. So, here’s something to look out for when you’re exploring the hills of Nagaland. 

Tekhumiavi
Penchapenchi
This monster out of Bengali folklore looks like an owl – yes, the dispenser of wisdom in animal stories – but it doesn’t exactly behave like one. A penchapenchi preys on forest dwellers, especially the ones who are foolish to wander off alone. Once the penchapenchi is sure that help is far away, it strikes down its prey and then drains their blood. Whether the victim turns into a penchapenchi (like in the case of a vampire bite) or not is yet to be confirmed.

Penchapenchi
Navagunjara
A mash-up of nine different animals, the navagunjara makes a special appearance in an Odia retelling of the Mahabharata as a manifestation of Vishnu. Story goes that when Arjuna, one of the Pandava princes, was in the middle of a penance, a strange creature appeared before him. Arjuna’s instinctive reaction, because he was terrified, was of course to point an arrow at it. The creature had the neck and head of a peacock, the hump of a bull, the waist of a lion, and the tail of a snake, and it stood on three different kinds of feet – an elephant’s, a horse or a deer’s and a tiger’s. Its fourth limb was human, which held a lotus. Before he let the arrow fly, Arjuna saw the lotus and realised what the creature truly represented. 

Navagunjara
Navagunjara
Naale Ba
An urban legend, mostly based in Karnataka, demands that the words Naale ba or ‘come tomorrow’ be painted outside houses (with no spelling mistakes, mind) to ward off a witch, who likes knocking on doors at night and murdering whoever’s unlucky enough to open them. Thankfully, the witch’s kryptonite seems to be her own politeness.

Naale Ba
Nishi
Monsters really do have a thing for lone travellers, don’t they? The nishi, found mostly in the forests of Bengal, Bihar and Jharkhand, are particularly vicious because they call out to their potential victims in the voice of their loved ones. Once the victims are lured into a well and truly secluded place, the nishi proceeds to kill them. Because they always appear in the distance, the only description we have of them is that they are shadowy creatures. Fortunately,  there is a way to identify these crafty creatures. If you hear the call thrice, you can rest assured that it’s not a nishi, because the ghost can, well, only be bothered to call out twice. The next time a loved one fondly calls out to you twice, there is no need to respond; flee.

Nishi
Gandeberunda
You probably already know the story of Narasimha, Vishnu’s hybrid avatar. Evil demon Hiranyakashipu gets a boon from Brahma that makes him practically invincible, which in turn gives him the licence to terrorize everyone. But when he tries to murder his own son, Vishnu decides that enough is enough and vanquishes Hiranyakashipu in the most creative way (you see, all boons come with loopholes) in his Narasimha avatar.

The story doesn’t end there though. Even with Hiranyakashipu out of the picture, Narasimha is still really, really angry, and afraid that his anger issues would destroy the world, the gods beseech Shiva to do something. Of course, the only way to tackle a powerful mythical creature is to turn into a powerful mythical creature yourself. Shiva becomes Sharabha – a half-lion (to match Narasimha, understandably) and half-bird form (the OG Angry Bird) – and manages to subdue Narasimha. The story is still not over, because Narasimha becomes Angrier Bird – taking on the form of Gandeberunda, a gigantic two-headed bird with Hulk-like strength. Sharabha, thankfully, calls it quits after 18 days of fighting and Gandeberunda also finally calms down. This powerful bird happens to be the state emblem of Karnataka, and the Gandeberunda motif can be found in many places in India, including temple architecture.

Gandeberunda
Decorative motif on the ceiling of Brihadeeswarar temple
Bhoota Vahana Yantra
It appears that robots are quite ancient. According to an 11th-century text, when Buddha died, it fell to King Ajatashatru of Magadha to protect his sacred relics. Ajatashatru concealed the relics in a secret underground chamber in his capital, Pataliputra (now Patna in Bihar). And the warriors who stood guard were automatons, but not just any automatons though. Bhoota Vahana Yantra literally means ‘spirit movement machine’, so these robots had spirits inside them that were responsible for their movements. Needless to say, these robots made excellent guards.

If you hear the call thrice, you can rest assured that it’s not a nishi, because the ghost can, well, only be bothered to call out twice. The next time a loved one fondly calls out to you twice, there is no need to respond; flee. Nishi Gandeberunda You probably already know the story of Narasimha, Vishnu’s hybrid avatar. Evil demon Hiranyakashipu gets a boon from Brahma that makes him practically invincible, which in turn gives him the licence to terrorize everyone. But when he tries to murder his own son, Vishnu decides that enough is enough and vanquishes Hiranyakashipu in the most creative way (you see, all boons come with loopholes) in his Narasimha avatar. The story doesn’t end there though. Even with Hiranyakashipu out of the picture, Narasimha is still really, really angry, and afraid that his anger issues would destroy the world, the gods beseech Shiva to do something. Of course, the only way to tackle a powerful mythical creature is to turn into a powerful mythical creature yourself. Shiva becomes Sharabha – a half-lion (to match Narasimha, understandably) and half-bird form (the OG Angry Bird) – and manages to subdue Narasimha. The story is still not over, because Narasimha becomes Angrier Bird – taking on the form of Gandeberunda, a gigantic two-headed bird with Hulk-like strength. Sharabha, thankfully, calls it quits after 18 days of fighting and Gandeberunda also finally calms down. This powerful bird happens to be the state emblem of Karnataka, and the Gandeberunda motif can be found in many places in India, including temple architecture. Gandeberunda Decorative motif on the ceiling of Brihadeeswarar temple Bhoota Vahana Yantra It appears that robots are quite ancient. According to an 11th-century text, when Buddha died, it fell to King Ajatashatru of Magadha to protect his sacred relics. Ajatashatru concealed the relics in a secret underground chamber in his capital, Pataliputra (now Patna in Bihar). And the warriors who stood guard were automatons, but not just any automatons though. Bhoota Vahana Yantra literally means ‘spirit movement machine’, so these robots had spirits inside them that were responsible for their movements. Needless to say, these robots made excellent guards.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Comparing New York City and Tokyo

New York City, often referred to as "The Big Apple," is a bustling metropolis known for its vibrant culture and towering skyscrapers. The city thrives on its fast-paced lifestyle, with people constantly on the move. The energy in NYC is palpable, whether you're walking through Times Square or riding the subway. It’s a melting pot of cultures, and this diversity is reflected in its food, neighborhoods, and festivals. The iconic skyline, featuring landmarks like the Empire State Building, gives the city a unique, unmistakable character.

On the other hand, Tokyo, Japan, offers a very different but equally fascinating experience. The city blends modern technology with traditional customs, making it a unique fusion of old and new. While the streets of Tokyo are just as busy as New York’s, there’s a sense of calm in the midst of all the hustle. Tokyo’s meticulous organization is evident in its efficient public transport system and the careful balance of green spaces amid urban sprawl. Unlike NYC’s chaotic energy, Tokyo's vibe is more orderly yet still vibrant, offering a serene escape in its parks and temples.

Both cities offer remarkable experiences, but while New York pulses with raw energy and diversity, Tokyo provides a harmonious blend of tradition and modernity.

The city thrives on its fast-paced lifestyle, with people constantly on the move. The energy in NYC is palpable, whether you're walking through Times Square or riding the subway. It’s a melting pot of cultures, and this diversity is reflected in its food, neighborhoods, and festivals. The iconic skyline, featuring landmarks like the Empire State Building, gives the city a unique, unmistakable character. On the other hand, Tokyo, Japan, offers a very different but equally fascinating experience. The city blends modern technology with traditional customs, making it a unique fusion of old and new. While the streets of Tokyo are just as busy as New York’s, there’s a sense of calm in the midst of all the hustle. Tokyo’s meticulous organization is evident in its efficient public transport system and the careful balance of green spaces amid urban sprawl. Unlike NYC’s chaotic energy, Tokyo's vibe is more orderly yet still vibrant, offering a serene escape in its parks and temples.
